climbs.name: Wild Brew Yonder
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Dave Haber & Jim Hammerle, 1993

content.description: Steep featured rock past two bolts close together then another bolt high above as the angle kicks back. Gear belay and walk-off.
content.protection: 3 bolts (3/8"), gear to 1 inches for the belay
content.location:
Climbs the narrow face between

Fissure Merde

and

Save the Ales

, starting off a ledge at the base.

content.description: This climb involves interesting stemming in a corner, and is harder than it looks.  It is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.

Pull up on less than stellar rock while using careful feet placement to reach the first bolt. Surf the dike up past two more bolts until you have to pull a strenuous move to reach the corner. Holds between bolts one and four are fantastic, while the last portion of the climb is a little gritty but very easy climbing.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a bolt and glue in anchor rap.
content.location: Approx 400 yards north of Save the Ales, or 75 yards north of Gila Monster. If walking in from the south, you get to the last rock that looks like it could host a real climb, and there's a low-lying, rounded blob yet to the north -- it's on the NE corner of this blob.  Route starts in a notch, and finishes above a medium-sized juniper. It follows a blocky prominent dike. If this route is your first or only destination on Cunning Rock, it's much faster to come in from the N or E.  Shade all day.

content.description: A fairly nice face route; quite runout, but not sustained.  According to Bartlett, it's 150' right of Jarhead, and starts lower on the formation. On a brown wall (same wall as Gila Monster), climbing thru buckets on the L side.. Climbs past a bolt and bushes.

climbs.name: Jarhead Central
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Jim Hammerle, February 1993

content.description: A strenuous and awkward thin crack with very coarse rock. It is about 125' right of Save the Ales. This route is not in the 1992 Vogel guide, but is depicted in Bartlett's.
A steep hand crack and crux offwidth leads to an exposed, runout face traverse left to the base of an easier fist crack.  This route is quite grainy.
content.protection: Include gear up to at least a #4 Camalot.

climbs.name: Fissure Merde
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Katie Wilkinson, November 1989

content.description: a mediocre shallow crack and knobby face.  It joins Cunning Route at the top.
Thin face climbing along a seam with fairly wide-spaced bolts.
Climbs past 2 bolts and 1 fixed pin.
content.location: Halfway between Never Cry Louie & Gila Monster.
